ISSUE.TITLE: `podman network` still mentions CNI in several places
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Now that we have multiple network backends it might make sense to remove CNI from the help pages: ``` $ podman network create --help|grep CNI create CNI networks for containers and pods $ podman network|grep CNI Error: missing command 'podman network COMMAND' inspect Displays the raw CNI network configuration for one or more networks. $ podman --version podman version 4.1.1 `

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #14968 from jmguzik/compat Compat API: unify pull/push and add missing progress info

COMMIT.MESSAGE: docs: remove CNI word where it is not applicable Most network commands/features work with both netavark and CNI. When we added added netavark most docs were not vetted and thus still use CNI network, it should just say network. Fixes #14990 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
